options: Crypto wallets store your private keys, keeping your crypto safe and accessible.
Using wallet one can send, receive, and spend crypto currencies
Crypto wallets differ from block chain to block chain
All of the options
questions.title: Which of the followings are correct for a crypto wallet?

options: Wallet can be used to send, receive crypto assets
Using wallet NFTs can be collected
Wallet can be used to swap tokens
All the options
questions.title: Which of following is true for a crypto wallet?

options: It is also known as a recovery phrase, mnemonic phrase, or backup phrase, is a sequence of words that are used to recover a user's private keys and restore access to their digital assets.
It's usually a set of 12-24 words that are generated by the wallet software
One can regenerate a new seed phrase for a wallet address once it's forgotten
Anyone with access to your seed phrase will have access to your digital assets
questions.title: Which of the followings is false for a seed phrase

options: Software wallets: These are digital wallets that can be installed on a computer or mobile device. Examples include desktop wallets, mobile wallets, and web wallets
Hardware wallets: These are physical devices, like a USB drive, that are used to store digital assets offline. They offer a higher level of security than software wallets.
Paper wallets: These are physical copies of a user's public and private keys that can be printed out and stored offline.
All of options
questions.title: What are the types of crypto wallets are there?

options: Choose a crypto wallet from a reputable provider that has a good track record of security
By keeping the private keys safe and not sharing with others
Being cautious of phishing attempts, by avoiding clicking on links or entering your private keys on suspicious websites or emails
All of the options
